definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: Shortly before I went abroad, this friend and I had been coeditor of a big book.
sentences.chinese: 出访前夕，我还在与他合作主编一本大书。

sentences.english: Saag also was the lead author of the 2008 RA-drug guidelines.
sentences.chinese: Saag博士也是2008年风湿病药物指南的主编。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee is a chief editor of this book.
sentences.chinese: 李先生是这本书的主编。

sentences.english: He has edited or co-edited eight books on health policy research.
sentences.chinese: 他主编或参与合编了8本关于健康政策研究的书籍。

sentences.english: He is the chief editor of the publication "minimally invasive surgery and urology map".
sentences.chinese: 主编出版学术专著《微创泌尿外科手术与图谱》。

sentences.english: Physical Chemistry. 5th ed. , P. W. Atkins. , Oxford University Press.
sentences.chinese: 物理化学解题指南，李文斌主编，天津大学出版社。

sentences.english: Although Associate Editor Paul prefers the Bounty Bear.
sentences.chinese: 尽管副主编保罗更喜欢“赏金熊”。

sentences.english: Sub-editor. Been all over the world," said Mark.
sentences.chinese: “是个有趣的家伙，副主编，世界各地跑，”马克说。

sentences.english: She authors five textbooks, and has published more than ten scholarly papers.
sentences.chinese: 主编教材和教辅五本，发表论文十余篇。

sentences.english: Editors-in-chief play a significant role in the development of periodicals.
sentences.chinese: 主编在期刊的发展中起着重要的作用。

sentences.english: The triumvirate is said to put a high priority on hiring a forty-something.
sentences.chinese: 据说“三巨头”倾向于雇佣一名四十来岁的主编。

sentences.english: He is an associate editor of the newspaper.
Edited "Biotherapy for Cancer", published more than 40 research papers.
sentences.chinese: 主编《肿瘤生物治疗学》，发表研究论文40余篇。

sentences.english: Ecology-Concepts and Applications, Manuel C. , Moller Jr. Higher Education Press.
sentences.chinese: 《生态学》，李博主编，高等教育出版社。

sentences.english: He is editor-in-chief of "Blue Star Poets' Club", and editor of "Modern Literature".
sentences.chinese: 蓝星诗社主编，《现代文学》编委等。

sentences.english: I reported it all in my story and faxed it back to my editor.
sentences.chinese: 我全面报道了这一切，然后将稿子传真给主编。

definition: chief editor (of newspaper)/abbr. for 總編輯|总编辑
(publishing) (abbr. for 美術編輯|美术编辑[mei3 shu4 bian1 ji2]) layout and graphics/graphic design/art editor/graphic designer
editor in charge (abbr. for 責任編輯|责任编辑[ze2 ren4 bian1 ji2])
(publishing) layout and graphics/graphic design/art editor/graphic designer
specially engaged/employed or commissioned for a special task
to gather up/to collect/to edit/to compile
to supervise the manufacture of/to supervise the shooting of films/executive producer (film)
